results.title: The IQ myth. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: An examination of the ways the IQ concept has been used and misused. It focuses on the question of how much importance should be placed on the test result. This can mean the difference between success or failure in school and adult life, and such exams have been used to categorise entire cultures and races as mentally inferior

results.title: I owe you
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage managers to consider their influence on the development of subordinate managers and supervisors. Highlights the dissatisfaction and frustrations aroused in subordinates when a manager overlooks their natural desire for development in their jobs. Describes the main points of an action plan devised to solve a work problem and improve subordinate skills.

results.title: I need more staff
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A management game which highlights pressures at the middle management level including competing staff claims and personality relationships. The film is intended to assist group analysis and discussion of management problems relating or organisational control and co-ordination, and for use in the training of middle and senior management groups. Cast includes Don Philps, Stanley Walsh, Bruce Myles, Ronald Morse, John Orcsik.

results.title: I name this ship
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The “Empress of Australia” built at Cockatoo Island Dockyard in Sydney Harbour, is the newest and the largest passenger vessel in the Australian Coastal Shipping Commission. On paper it represented a unique challenge to the Australian ship building industry. Designed to carry passengers and motor vehicles as well as freight between Sydney and Tasmania. Provides luxurious passenger accommodation, services and recreational facilties for the 40 hour trip.

results.title: I know an old lady who swallowed a fly
results.creator_credit: Derek Lamb, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A nonsense song, sung by Burl Ives and given unrestrained interpretation by the cartoonist. Of course, by the time the song ends the old lady has swallowed much more than a fly. Written by Canadian folksinger Alan Mills. (Awards: Santa Barbara; Chicago; Gottwaldov)

results.title: I just work here
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how customer service can be improved when the person providing the service makes an extra effort to understand the customer’s point of view and does not rigidly adhere to the rules.

results.title: I Is for important
results.brief_description: The film covers examples of sex role stereotyping in social interaction and emotional expression in schools. The scenes include sex role bias in disciplinary actions and student task assignments and children’s resistance to role reversal in kindergarten play.

results.title: I have Turkish blood in my body, how can I put it off? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An interview with two Turkish girls living in Australia which highlights family life in Turkish culture in comparison to Anglo Australian family life. Further it demonstrates clearly the substantial differences between sub-groups in the Turkish community.

results.title: I give my heart
results.creator_credit: Gillian Coote, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
Tells the story of Ulla, a volunteer worker for the Laotian refugees coming into Australia. Ulla, having experienced growing up under Hitler, is committed to helping humanity. She works about ten to twelve hours a day but still doesn’t have enough time to finish her work. She is hopeful of forthecoming government assistance.
